title: Protect Paws from Ice & Salt
description: Winter ice and road salt can damage your pet's paw pads, causing cracks and irritation. Use pet-safe paw balm before walks and wipe paws clean afterward to prevent ingestion of harmful chemicals.

title: Maintain Proper Hydration
description: Pets can become dehydrated in winter due to dry indoor heating. Ensure fresh water is always available and check outdoor water bowls frequently as they can freeze. Proper hydration supports healthy skin and organ function.

title: Prevent Hypothermia & Frostbite
description: Small, elderly, or short-haired pets are vulnerable to cold temperatures. Limit outdoor time in freezing weather, provide warm bedding away from drafts, and consider pet sweaters for extra protection during walks.

title: Watch for Dry Skin & Coat Issues
description: Winter heating dries out pet skin, causing itching and flaking. Brush regularly to distribute natural oils, limit baths to preserve moisture, and add omega-3 supplements to their diet for healthy skin and a shiny coat.
